thread.title: Mariners claim right-hander Cody Martin off waivers from Athletics
thread.title_full: Mariners claim right-hander Cody Martin off waivers from Athletics

author: ADAM LEWIS, SEATTLEPI.COM
title: Mariners claim right-hander Cody Martin off waivers from Athletics
text:
Mariners claim right-hander Cody Martin off waivers from Athletics By ADAM LEWIS, SEATTLEPI.COM Updated 1:53 pm, Monday, October 19, 2015 Image 1 of / 2 Close Image 1 of 2 CHICAGO, IL - Cody Martin #63 of the Oakland Athletics pitches against the Chicago White Sox during the first inning at U.S. Cellular Field on September 16, 2015. (Photo by Jon Durr/Getty Images) CHICAGO, IL - Cody Martin #63 of the Oakland Athletics pitches against the Chicago White Sox during the first inning at U.S. Cellular Field on September 16, 2015. (Photo by Jon Durr/Getty Images) Image 2 of 2 SEATTLE, WA - Relief pitcher Logan Kensing #27 of the Seattle Mariners pitches against the Chicago White Sox at Safeco Field on August 23, 2015. (Photo by Otto Greule Jr/Getty Images) SEATTLE, WA - Relief pitcher Logan Kensing #27 of the Seattle Mariners pitches against the Chicago White Sox at Safeco Field on August 23, 2015. (Photo by Otto Greule Jr/Getty Images) Mariners claim right-hander Cody Martin off waivers from Athletics 1 / 2 Back to Gallery 
The Seattle Mariners on Monday claimed right-hander Cody Martin off waivers and released reliever Logan Kensing in what marked Jerry Dipoto's first player acquisition since being hired as general manager. 
Martin will take Kensing's place on the 40-man roster after he spent last season with the Braves and Athletics' organizations. 
Martin, 26, combined this year to go 2-5 with a 7.92 ERA in 25 appearances (two starts) in the big leagues. He performed better in the minors, combining to go 5-7 with a 4.01 ERA in 18 games (17 starts) and one save with Atlanta and Oakland's Triple-A affiliates. The Braves traded him to the A's on July 2. 
He made two starts for Oakland in September and both went poorly (combined six innings, 11 runs, two losses). 
In five minor league seasons, Martin, a seventh-round pick by Atlanta in the 2011 MLB draft, is 31-29 with a 3.24 ERA and a 1.26 WHIP in 118 games (84 starts). 
Meanwhile, Kensing was 2-1 with a 5.87 ERA in 19 appearances this season with the Mariners. The 33-year-old was also 2-0 with a 2.23 ERA in 19 appearances with the Rainiers before getting recalled in late August.
